full_text: Screened by NARA, 5/5/2023 STATE Immigration & Naturalization Service 9858 Artesia Boulevard, Bellflower, California 90706 Application for Naturalization (N-400) File No: A 41623672 The results of your examination are checked below: Date: 9/13/96 RE-EXAM You will be scheduled for a re-examination within 120 days for the following reason : You have failed the following tests: ) History and Government Your ability to : ( ) Read, ( ) Write, ( Speak, or Understand, English You will be notified by mail regarding the date and time of your reexamination. See 1 Below ] You have passed your examination, but cannot sign your certificate until you present the following document(s) You will be notified by mail within 120 days to appear with the documents. [ See 1 Below ] ) Arrest Report (and) (or) Court Disposition for . NOTE: Final Court Disposition must include Conviction Status, Sentencing, and Probation. ( ) Birth Certificate of . ( ) Marriage Certificate of . ( ) Interlocutory (and) (or) Final Divorce Decree of . ( ) Death Certificate of . ( ) Adoption Decree (and) (or) Court Order of Name Change . ( ) Proof of Spousal (and) (or) Child Support for . ( ) Proof of Selective Service Registration [Call (847) )688-6888] . NOTE: 1. If you failed to register with the Selective Service System before you reached age 26, you will be sent a Questionnaire form. Answer the questions fully, Make A Copy, and return the form to the Selective Service. 2. You will then receive an Advisory Letter from the Selective Service. 3. Bring the copy of the Questionnaire and the Advisory Letter with you to your next appointment at this office. ( ) Tax Clearance from I.R.S. for tax year(s) ( ) Letter from Church regarding religious beliefs in Bearing Arms. ( ) Letter from Person(s) who gave Affidavit of Support at the time of your lawful entry into the United States. ( ) Letter from Department of Social Services (and) (or) Social Security Administration regarding your eligibility. ( ) Other NOTE: All documents must be Original or Certified Copies. Any document in a foreign language must be accompanied by a certified English translation. 1 If you do not receive another appointment, after 120 days, WRITE to INS, 300 N. Los Angeles St., Los Angeles, CA 90012, Attention N-400 Continued Unit, Room 8010, to inquire about your case. Failure to appear with the requested documents will result in denial of your application. Disability Waiver. In order to establish your eligibility for Naturalization under Section 312(b)(1), INA, you are requested to submit an attestation from a Designated Civil Surgeon (see Section 234 of 8 C.F.R.). The attestation should include a Diagnosis and Prognosis regarding your medical condition. Please submit the statement to the Continued Unit located on the 8th floor, Room 8304, 300 N. Los Angeles Street, Los Angeles, CA 90012, no earlier than thirty days from the date of this notice. CONTINUED You have passed your examination, but your case is being held pending further review. Officer : Wolest BLF 4 (Rev. 6/5/96) N400CONT.DOC
